title: Implement NUM layer
description:
Add NUM layer to config/corne.keymap. Accessed by holding BSPC (right thumb middle).

IMPORTANT: Before writing code, explore ZMK conventions at:
- /Users/dhavalsavalia/projects/keyboard/zmk/app/src/behaviors/

Refer to keymap.yaml lines 33-37 for exact bindings.
design:
## NUM Layer (from keymap.yaml)
Purpose: Numpad-style number entry + right-side modifiers for one-handed Cmd+1 combos

Row 0: none    [       7       8       9       ]       none    none    none    none    none    none
Row 1: none    ;       4       5       6       =       none    RSHFT   RCTRL   RALT    RGUI    none
Row 2: none    `       1       2       3       \       none    none    none    none    none    none
Thumb:                 .       0       -               trans   (held)  trans

## Key Translations
- `&kp LBKT` for [
- `&kp RBKT` for ]
- `&kp N7` through `&kp N9` for numbers
- `&kp EQUAL` for =
- `&kp BSLH` for \
- `&kp GRAVE` for `
- `&kp DOT`, `&kp N0`, `&kp MINUS` for thumb
- `&trans` for transparent (use lower layer)
- `&none` for no action
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] NUM layer has all 42 keys
- [ ] Numbers in numpad arrangement (789/456/123)
- [ ] Right side has modifiers (RSHFT, RCTRL, RALT, RGUI)
- [ ] Thumb row: . 0 - on left, trans/held/trans on right
- [ ] Compiles without errors
close_reason: NUM layer implemented with numpad-style numbers (789/456/123), right-side modifiers (RSHFT/RCTRL/RALT/RGUI), and thumb row (./0/-). Build verified.

title: Implement MEDIA layer with Bluetooth
description:

IMPORTANT: Before writing code, explore ZMK conventions at:

design:
## MEDIA Layer (from keymap.yaml)
Purpose: Media controls, brightness, Bluetooth profiles

Row 0: none    none    none    none    none    none    none    none    none    none    BRI+    none
Row 1: none    LGUI    LALT    LCTRL   LSHFT   none    PREV    VOL-    VOL+    NEXT    BRI-    none
Row 2: none    BT0     BT1     BT2     BT3     BT_CLR  none    none    none    none    none    none
Thumb:                 (held)  trans   trans           STOP    PP      MUTE

## Key Translations
- `&kp C_BRI_UP` / `&kp C_BRI_DN` for brightness
- `&kp LGUI`, `&kp LALT`, `&kp LCTRL`, `&kp LSHFT` for modifiers (one-handed combos)
- `&kp C_PREV` / `&kp C_NEXT` for previous/next track
- `&kp C_VOL_DN` / `&kp C_VOL_UP` for volume
- `&bt BT_SEL 0` through `&bt BT_SEL 3` for Bluetooth profiles
- `&bt BT_CLR` for clear Bluetooth profile
- `&kp C_STOP` for stop
- `&kp C_PP` for play/pause
- `&kp C_MUTE` for mute

- [ ] Left modifiers for one-handed combos
- [ ] Media controls on right side
- [ ] Bluetooth profiles BT0-BT3 and BT_CLR
- [ ] Thumb: STOP, PP (play/pause), MUTE

title: Set up keymap-drawer GitHub Action
description: Create GitHub workflow that auto-generates SVG visualization of the keymap when config/*.keymap changes.
design:
## Files to create

### keymap_drawer.config.yaml
```yaml
parse_config:
  preprocess: true
  zmk_additional_includes:
    - "behaviors.dtsi"

draw_config:
  key_h: 56
  key_w: 60
  split_gap: 30
```

### .github/workflows/draw-keymap.yml
```yaml
name: Draw ZMK keymaps
on:
  push:
    paths:
      - "config/*.keymap"
      - "keymap_drawer.config.yaml"
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  draw:
    uses: caksoylar/keymap-drawer/.github/workflows/draw-zmk.yml@main
    permissions:
      contents: write
    with:
      keymap_patterns: "config/*.keymap"
      config_path: "keymap_drawer.config.yaml"
      output_folder: "keymap-drawer"
      amend_commit: true
```
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Workflow triggers on keymap changes
- [x] SVG generated in keymap-drawer/ folder
- [ ] Visualization matches keymap design (needs push to test)
notes: Created keymap_drawer.config.yaml with parse/draw config and .github/workflows/draw-keymap.yml that triggers on keymap changes. Uses caksoylar/keymap-drawer reusable workflow.
close_reason: Workflow and config created. Final acceptance item will be verified on first push.

title: Implement FUN layer
description:
Add FUN layer to config/corne.keymap. Accessed by holding DEL (right thumb outer).

IMPORTANT: Before writing code, explore ZMK conventions at:
- /Users/dhavalsavalia/projects/keyboard/zmk/app/src/behaviors/

Refer to keymap.yaml lines 58-62 for exact bindings.
design:
## FUN Layer (from keymap.yaml)
Purpose: F-keys in numpad arrangement + arrows + navigation

Row 0: none    F12     F7      F8      F9      PSCRN   none    none    none    none    none    none
Row 1: none    F11     F4      F5      F6      SLCK    LEFT    DOWN    UP      RIGHT   none    none
Row 2: none    F10     F1      F2      F3      PAUSE   HOME    PGDN    PGUP    END     INS     none
Thumb:                 trans   trans   trans           trans   trans   (held)

## Key Translations
- `&kp F1` through `&kp F12` for function keys
- `&kp PSCRN` for Print Screen
- `&kp SLCK` for Scroll Lock
- `&kp PAUSE_BREAK` for Pause
- `&kp LEFT`, `&kp DOWN`, `&kp UP`, `&kp RIGHT` for arrows
- `&kp HOME`, `&kp END` for home/end
- `&kp PG_UP`, `&kp PG_DN` for page up/down
- `&kp INS` for Insert
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] FUN layer has all 42 keys
- [x] F-keys in numpad arrangement (F12/F7-F9, F11/F4-F6, F10/F1-F3)
- [x] Arrow keys on right side home row
- [x] Navigation keys (HOME, END, PGUP, PGDN) on right bottom
- [x] Compiles without errors
notes: Implemented FUN layer with F-keys in numpad arrangement (F12/F7-F9 top, F11/F4-F6 middle, F10/F1-F3 bottom) on left side, arrow keys on right home row, navigation (HOME/PGDN/PGUP/END/INS) on right bottom row. Used PAUSE_BREAK for Pause key per ZMK convention.
close_reason: FUN layer implemented with F-keys (numpad arrangement), arrow keys, and navigation. Build successful.

title: Add special keys: Caps Word and tmux prefix
description: Add Caps Word on left outer middle and Ctrl+S (tmux prefix) on left outer bottom of BASE layer.
design:
## Outer column layout (left side, BASE layer)
```
Row 0: ` (grave)
Row 1: Caps Word  -> &caps_word
Row 2: C-s        -> &kp LC(S)
```

## Caps Word behavior
Built-in ZMK behavior, auto-disables after non-letter key.

## Tmux prefix
`&kp LC(S)` sends Ctrl+S for tmux prefix key.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Caps Word activates and deactivates correctly
- [ ] Ctrl+S triggers tmux prefix
- [ ] Both accessible from BASE layer outer column
